Regarding the phenomenon of 'lightening'in primigravida at term pregnancy, which one of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a welcome sign since it indicates descent fetal head into pelvis.

options.label: B
options.text: There are no bladder or bowel symptoms associated with this phenomenon.

options.label: C
options.text: It occurs later and just before labour in primigravida compared to multigravida.

options.label: D
options.text: It is associated with worsening of cardiorespiratory embarrassment in mother.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is a welcome sign since it indicates descent fetal head into pelvis.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • ? Lightening: Few (2-3) weeks prior to the onset of labor especially in primigravidae, the presenting part descent into the true pelvis, reduces fundal pressure on the diaphragm and relieve the mechanical cardiorespiratory embarrassment. There may be frequency of micturition or constipation due to pressure by the engaged presenting part. It is a welcome sign which rules out cephalopelvic disproportion and other conditions preventing the head from entering the pelvic inlet.
  • • ? Cervical changes: Few days prior to the onset of labor, cervix becomes ripe which is- soft, 80% effaced (<1.5 cm in length), admits one finger easily, and cervical canal is dilatable.

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true about 'End TB Strategy'? 1. The strategy goes beyond patient care to promote TB prevention. 2. The targets are to be achieved by 2035. 3. The milestone for 2025 is to reduce the TB deaths by 35% compared to 2015. 4. The strategy identifies four barriers to achieve progress in fight against TB. Select the correct answer using the code given below.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Measured by the number of people who die each year due to tuberculosis, it is the deadliest infectious disease. The WHO "End TB strategy". adopted by the World Health Assembly in May 2014. The DOTS strategy (1994) helped revitalize national tuberculosis programmes and equivalent entities by putting in place the essential basics to address the TB epidemic. The "Stop TB strategy" (2006) broadened the response by addressing the emerging challenges of HIV associated TB and MDR-TB etc. It improves access to quality TB care by engaging all public and private care providers, civil society organizations and communities. The End TB Strategy (2015) encompasses a package of interventions that can be fully adopted at country level. The strategy envisions universal access to high-quality TB care and goes beyond it to promote TB prevention. The End TB Strategy identifies four barriers in the fight against TB. These are (a) weak health system. (b) underlying determinants of TB such as poverty, undernutrition, migration and ageing population and risk factors such as diabetes, silicosis and smoking etc, (3) lack of effective tools, and (4) continuous unmet- funding needs. Some other points regarding End TB strategy

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Pregnancy-related death: Death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy, irrespective of the cause of death
  • • Maternal death: defined as "the death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 days of termination of pregnancy, irrespective of the duration and site of pregnancy, from any cause related to or aggravated by the pregnancy or its management but not from accidental or incidental causes-
  • • Maternal mortality ratio measures women dying from "puerperal causes" and is defined as:-
